ctx: intros P Q R HOBuch Hforall.
tactic: induction HOBuch as [| a aP Q R Hadd Hrec].
exceptions.exn: Expects a disjunctive pattern with 3 branches.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Set
A1: A
A0: A
eqA: A -> A -> Prop
plusA: A -> A -> A
invA: A -> A
multA: A -> A -> A
minusA: A -> A -> A
divA: A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A
cs: CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA
eqA_dec: forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b}
n: nat
ltM: mon n -> mon n -> Prop
ltM_dec: forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b}
os: OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n)

Goal:
forall P Q R : list (poly A0 eqA ltM), OBuch P Q R -> (forall a : poly A0 eqA ltM, In a Q -> Cb A A0 eqA plusA multA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec a P) -> stable P R

Premises:
Inductive OBuch : list (poly A0 eqA ltM) -> list (poly A0 eqA ltM) -> list (poly A0 eqA ltM) -> Prop := OBuch0 : forall aL : list (poly A0 eqA ltM), OBuch aL nil aL | OBuch1 : forall (a : poly A0 eqA ltM) (aP Q R : list (poly A0 eqA ltM)), OBuch (addEnd A A0 eqA n ltM (nf A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA cs eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec os a aP) aP) (genPcP

reduce_cb2 : forall (A : Set) (A0 A1 : A) (eqA : A -> A -> Prop) (plusA : A -> A -> A) (invA : A -> A) (minusA multA : A -> A -> A) (divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A), CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA ->...-> CombLinear A A0 eqA plusA multA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec (b :: Q) (s2p A A0 eqA n ltM a)
reduceplus_mults : forall (A : Set) (A0 A1 : A) (eqA : A -> A -> Prop) (plusA : A -> A -> A) (invA : A -> A) (minusA multA : A -> A -> A) (divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A), CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA ->...-> reduceplus A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec Q (mults multA (n:=n) a p) (mults multA (n:=n) a q)

```coq
intros P Q R HOBuch Hforall.
induction HOBuch as [| a aP Q R Hadd Hrec].
- intros a HaQ; apply Hforall; assumption.
- intros a HaQ.
  apply Hforall in HaQ.
  apply Cb_genPcPf with (i:=a) (P:=addEnd A A0 eqA n ltM (nf A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA cs eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec a aP) aP) (R:=R); try assumption.
  apply Cb_incl; try assumption.
  intros b HbQ.
  apply CombLinear_trans1 with (Q:=Q); try assumption.
  apply CombLinear_trans_cons_lem with (Q:=Q); try assumption.
  apply CombLinear_mults1; try assumption.
  apply reduce_cb2; try assumption.
Qed.

original: intros P Q R HOBuch Hforall. induction HOBuch as [| a aP Q R Hadd Hrec]. - intros a HaQ; apply Hforall; auto. - intros a HaQ. apply Hforall in HaQ. apply Cb_genPcPf with (i:=a) (P:=addEnd A A0 eqA n ltM (nf A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA cs eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec a aP) aP) (R:=R); try auto. apply Cb_incl; try auto. intros b HbQ. apply CombLinear_trans1 with (Q:=Q); try auto. apply CombLinear_trans_cons_lem with (Q:=Q); try auto. apply CombLinear_mults1; try auto. apply reduce_cb2; try auto.
